name: sb5
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0
body: |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), w0)))

comment: Alternate definition of substitution when variables are disjoint. Similar to Theorem 6.1 of [Quine] p. 40. The implication "to the right" is ~ sb1 and does not require any disjoint variable condition. Theorem ~ sb5f replaces the disjoint variable condition with a non-freeness hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)
